intro: Tristira celebica, commonly known as the Celebes tristira, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
